para.sentence: R_{G}\left(x,y,z\right) and R_{F}\left(x,y,z\right) occur as the expectation values, relative to a normal probability distribution in {\mathbb{R}^{2}} or {\mathbb{R}^{3}} , of the square root or reciprocal square root of a quadratic form.

More generally, let \mathbf{A} ( =[a_{r,s}] ) and \mathbf{B} ( =[b_{r,s}] ) be real positive-definite matrices with n rows and n columns, and let \lambda_{1},\dots,\lambda_{n} be the eigenvalues of \mathbf{A}\mathbf{B}^{-1}.

If \mathbf{x} is a column vector with elements x_{1},x_{2},\dots,x_{n} and transpose \mathbf{x}^{\mathrm{T}} , then \mathbf{x}^{\mathrm{T}}\mathbf{A}\mathbf{x}=\sum_{r=1}^{n}\sum_{s=1}^{n}a_{r,s }x_{r}x_{s}, and \int_{{\mathbb{R}^{n}}}(\mathbf{x}^{\mathrm{T}}\mathbf{A}\mathbf{x})^{\mu}\exp \left(-\mathbf{x}^{\mathrm{T}}\mathbf{B}\mathbf{x}\right)\mathrm{d}x_{1}\cdots \mathrm{d}x_{n}=\frac{\pi^{n/2}\Gamma\left(\mu+\tfrac{1}{2}n\right)}{\sqrt{ \det\mathbf{B}}\Gamma\left(\tfrac{1}{2}n\right)}R_{\mu}\left(\tfrac{1}{2}, \dots,\tfrac{1}{2};\lambda_{1},\dots,\lambda_{n}\right), if \mu>-\tfrac{1}{2}n.
ยง19.16(iii) shows that for n=3 the incomplete cases of R_{F} and R_{G} occur when \mu=-1/2 and \mu=1/2 , respectively, while their complete cases occur when n=2.
